title: jpbh81
author: jpbh81
content: I am excited to present to you an enticing proposal: A weekly podcast dedicated to our community! The idea behind this project is to create an inclusive discussion space where forum members, along with experts from various fields, come together to review the week in the world of cryptocurrencies and highlight the best forum posts and more things.BitcoinTalk podcast goals:Community Interaction: Encourage active participation from forum members in dynamic discussions and conversations about the hottest topics of the week.Inclusivity: Invite experts in cryptocurrencies, blockchain technology, and finance to enrich discussions and provide diverse perspectives.Weekly Recap: Provide a concise summary of the most significant events of the week in the cryptocurrency space, keeping our community informed(no media control).Showcasing the Best Forum Posts: Recognize and discuss the most relevant and valuable posts made by our own members during the week.This podcast/talk show it wont be dense, because the main point its to inform people with transparency, bring to light the most OG people in this forum and in the bitcoin ecosystem. I want this podcast to be a collaborative effort. If you have ideas, suggestions, or would like to be part of the panel or even be a special guest, i would love to hear from you! Leave your comments in this thread. I would also ENHANCE the moderators, ADMINS to reply AND JOIN , im tired to see the twitter media and this ''crypto influencers'' misinforming people.

comments.author: larry_vw_1955
comments.body: Quote from: jpbh81 on January 19, 2024, 11:00:43 PMI am excited to present to you an enticing proposal: A weekly podcast dedicated to our community! The idea behind this project is to create an inclusive discussion space where forum members, along with experts from various fields, come together to review the week in the world of cryptocurrencies and highlight the best forum posts and more things.I think it's a good idea worth pursuing. However keep in mind that there's tons of youtube channels covering every aspect of crypto. about the only thing I don't think they ever talk about is the bitcointalk forum!   also, I'd recommend a bi-weekly or even monthly. i think weekly might get to be too much of a chore unless you have a sponsor.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: This is a good idea, somewhat similar to the bitcointalkshow on YouTube which sadly is not so active anymore. It would take a lot to get members that would be willing to 'speak' weekly, every two weeks or one month may be a better idea. I would also advice you book speakers for at least 3-5 episodes before you kickstart the program,bthat way every week or two weeks is notba struggle to get the next willing member to join.Best of luck.

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: This idea is quite good where in this podcast there will be many things that will be discussed and it will provide a lot of knowledge to the members of this forum and the wider audience. But the problem is that it becomes difficult when you want to invite several members of this forum to join the podcast because most of the members prefer to be anonymous and not known to the public. Moreover, not everyone has time to attend the podcast event, perhaps due to time differences or other reasons, and you need sponsors to be able to host the podcast. So that's why podcasts like this are not very relevant in this forum.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: There is already a channel on Discord in which people can chat, and you can coordinate with some members to present a podcast there, but since some people tend to hide their identity, you may find some people wary of joining those channels, as through voice, more data can be collected about you.Written communication is more convenient for expressing feelings and conveying information.
